All dharmas are without superiority, all dharmas are without inferiority.
Thus, unmoving, well abiding in the Dharma realm,
Because of peacefully abiding without moving, one then attains the unsurpassed abiding.
Not abiding in the characteristics of abiding, this is the courageous one,
Not abiding in the abode, unmoving in the abode.
Accomplishing the abode of non-abiding, one then attains peaceful and stable abiding,
Whether it is a proper place or not, there is no movement whatsoever.
Abiding in the immovable place is called being immovable.
If abiding in the immovable place, there is no abiding anywhere.
Not contemplating proper or improper places, always abiding in non-discrimination,
Not abiding in a place, then there is no movement.ğŸ”½Not moving in a place, all attain non-abiding.
If attaining non-abiding, proper and improper places are unmoving.ğŸ”½If unmoving in a place, then skillfully abiding in a place,
Skillfully abiding in a place and peacefully dwelling, then dwelling in non-abiding,
Able to see all dharmas, abiding in accordance with the characteristics of dharmas.
Thus seeing all dharmas, various without abiding,
Without abiding and without peaceful dwelling, skillful in abiding in the Dharma.
Always abiding in all dharmas, yet without discrimination,
Because they are free from all discrimination, they are called the unmoving ones.
If one can abide in the unmoving, without discrimination in practice,
Far removed from the possible and impossible, they are called the observers.
If one can observe the unmoving, with nothing moving at all,
All dharmas are always equal, thus they set out.
Abiding in accordance with principle, in accord with principle and unmoving,
Attaining the place of non-movement, always abiding in the absence of place.
At that time, the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattva Boundless Victory again addressed the Buddha, saying:
It is rare, World-Honored One!
You are able to establish the Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas in the principle of the Dharma, without bondage and without liberation.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas skillfully establish the principles of the Dharma, not associating with any dharmas, whether in association or non-association, whether in combination or non-combination, whether in inclusion or non-inclusion, whether having a refuge or having no refuge, whether in greed or separation from greed, whether in anger or separation from anger.
World-Honored One!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas skillfully establish the principles of all dharmas. Even if sentient beings make offerings and pay respects, they do not give rise to greed and love, and if they are reviled and oppressed, they do not give rise to anger. They are free from various thoughts and are apart from all dharmas.
They do not see any dharma that can be associated with any other dharma, whether in association or non-association. Because they have transcended association and non-association.
They are far removed from the thought of association and non-association, and understand the thought of association and non-association.
They have transcended understanding and do not associate with any dharma, whether advancing or retreating, whether having a destination or having no destination.
Within the principles of all dharmas, there is no false thought, nor is there anything to grasp. With skillful means, the nature of dharmas is not destroyed.
World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in this way with regard to all dharmas, they are able to skillfully proclaim the principles of the Dharma realm and quickly perfect all buddha-dharmas.
At that time the World-Honored One told the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva Boundless Wisdom:
Boundless Wisdom!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not establish themselves in the Buddha Dharma and do not abide in anything, they see the Buddha Dharma as having no establishment and no abiding, also having no superior abiding and no universal abiding. Because they see the Buddha Dharma abiding without wavering, without flowing and changing, all principles are in accord with the Dharma realm and abide therein, and this is called skillfully establishing the principles of the Dharma realm.
Boundless Wisdom!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, within the Buddha Dharma, have no abiding and no non-abiding, no superior abiding and no universal abiding, no abiding in places and no abiding in non-places, and also have no movement, also have no discrimination, no superior discrimination, and no universal discrimination. This is called skillfully establishing the principles of the Dharma realm.
Boundless Wisdom!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see any dharma that can be established with any other dharma, and also do not see any place where all dharmas are superiorly established. Also having no discrimination, no superior discrimination, and no universal discrimination, this is called skillfully establishing the principles of the Dharma realm.
Boundless Wisdom!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas do not see even the slightest dharma that abides or departs, nor do they have discriminating thoughts, superior discriminating thoughts, or universal discriminating thoughts. They see all dharmas as pure like empty space, with radiant illumination and far removed from afflictions. Because of the radiant illumination of all dharmas, it is called the skillful means of attaining the principles of the realm of all dharmas, not observing the dharma realm through establishment.
Why is it so?
Because in the dharma realm there is not even the slightest establishment.
It is just like empty space and the wind element, which have no location, are also invisible, have no location to be established, no location to rely on, and nothing to manifest.
The dharma realm is also like this, with no location to enter, no location to see, no location to be established, no location to rely on, and also no cognition or manifestation.
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have nothing to manifest, they abide in accord with the realm of suchness.
Anantamati!
The dharma realm is without birth, without life, without aging, without death, without rising, without sinking, and without manifesting realms.
The dharma realm is without changing realms. The dharma realm is everywhere.
Anantamati!
The dharma realm has no going and no place to go. Because there is no place to go, it is called abiding in accordance with the dharma realm.
The dharma realm is thusness. Within it there is no place and no non-place.
Why is it so?
Because the dharma realm is thusness, and the nature of thusness is non-existent.
Anantamati!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas hear this teaching of mine, they will attain boundless great Dharma illumination with regard to the principles of the entire dharma realm.

Through the illumination of the Dharma, they will attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, and will quickly be able to perfect the TathÄgata's ten powers, eighteen distinctive abilities, and all Buddha-dharmas.

In order to mature the vast roots of goodness and excellent provisions of all sentient beings, in order to ensure the continuity of the TathÄgata's lineage, to quickly approach the site of enlightenment and turn the wheel of the Dharma, to overshadow the palaces of MÄra and subdue heterodox theories, to make the great lion's roar of a good man, to expound the wonderful Dharma for sentient beings, in accordance with their desires, in accordance with their aspirations, and in accordance with their correct liberation, to cause them all to proceed towards supreme perfect enlightenment.
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
All bodhisattvas do not abide in dharmas, in the Buddha Dharma,
they are not established.
Because all bodhisattvas are not established, in the Buddha Dharma, they fearlessly proceed.
All bodhisattvas see the Buddha Dharma, without abiding, without location, well established.
All bodhisattvas, not dwelling in any place, are able to see all dharmas,
without abiding and without retreating.
All bodhisattvas, seeing dharmas as non-abiding, do not move the Buddha's teachings, and do not seek the Buddha's teachings.
All bodhisattvas, seeing dharmas as non-differentiated, do not move the Buddha's teachings, and also do not investigate.
All bodhisattvas, seeing dharmas as such, are skillful with regard to the Dharma,
and abide by skillful means.
Not dwelling in the Buddha's teachings, yet not non-dwelling, always without a dwelling place,
yet not non-existent, always non-discriminating, yet not non-discriminating,
various discriminations always do not exist.
All bodhisattvas, without the characteristics of abiding, in all times and places, are without movement.
All bodhisattvas, with regard to the principles of the Dharma, when abiding in equality,
Is called good abiding.
All bodhisattvas, in the principles of the Dharma, do not see even the slightest dharma that can abide in equality.
They are able to see all dharmas as having no location, and also not apart from location,
Attaining immobility, and also no intimacy.
In all dharmas, skillful in the principles, skillfully abiding,
Abiding in non-abiding, is called a bodhisattva.
Not in the slightest dharma, going or coming, discriminating and abiding,
At that time, then abiding in the principles of all dharmas.
In the principles of the Dharma, various abidings, able to give rise to boundless,
Great Dharma illumination.
Seeing all dharmas and the principles of the Dharma, like pure empty space,
Like a shadow, like a reflection, equal, without defilement.
All bodhisattvas, in seeing and understanding, also have no understanding, and are far removed from self-nature.
All bodhisattvas, contemplating in this way, with regard to all dharmas,
Abiding in the principle, are able to firmly cultivate the dharma realm,
And are called the skillful means of the principle of the dharma realm.
All bodhisattvas, not dwelling in the dharma realm, contemplate the dharma realm, which is ultimately non-existent.
All bodhisattvas, decisively understanding the dharma realm, see all dharmas,
Like space and wind, without establishment, pervading everywhere.
The dharma realm is also like this, pervading everywhere. The dharma realm is difficult to conceive,
And cannot be manifested.
The realm without manifestation is then the dharma realm, without a place to dwell,
Is called the dweller.
The dharma realm is unborn, without life, without aging, without death, without sinking, and also without liberation.
Without coming or going, the dharma realm is not the aggregates, not the elements, not the sense bases,
And yet it is not apart from the sense bases, and it does not move anywhere.
The dharma realm is thusness, its intrinsic nature is non-existent.
All bodhisattvas, understanding in this way, the inconceivable dharma realm, attain the light of the Dharma.
Approaching the site of enlightenment, they have no doubts regarding the Buddha's teachings,
And are unmoved. With the light of the Dharma, they cause all sentient beings
To attain great peace and joy.
Anantamati!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who are able to diligently practice in this profound Dharma attain such great Dharma illumination, and with this wisdom they set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.
